description:
The redevelopment of the site for the provision of 59
social housing units
as shown on drawing numbers 303/101F  102D  104E  105C
108D  109D  111F  112E  115D  116D  118C & 119C  revised
by letters dated 9 September 1992  12 October 1992 and
11 November 1992.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Details of the brick type, paving materials, windows,
    railings, gates, balustrades, coping, string coursing, and
    cornice moulding, shall not be otherwise than as shall have
    been submitted to and approved by the Council before any
    work on site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - No pipes or plumbing other than rainwater pipes shall be
    fixed on the external face of the buildings.

Condition : 3 - The whole of the car parking and cycle parking
    accommodation shown on the drawings shall be provided and
    retained permanently for the parking of vehicles of the
    occupiers and visitors to the buildings.

Condition : 4 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 5 - Details of the surface materials to be used and traffic
    signage shall have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council before any work on site is commenced.

Condition : 6 - A scheme for the screening of balconies shall be submitted
    to and approved by the Council before the development is
    commenced.

Condition : 7 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the buildings.

Condition : 8 - Because it is considered that these would seriously detract
    from the appearance of the buildings.

Condition : 9 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the
    buildings does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 10 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 11 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the safety
    of traffic movement within the site.

Condition : 12 - Tp prevent the overlooking of adjoining residential
    premises to the detriment of their amenity.

Condition : 13 - 01Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    take place other than between the hours of 8 am to 6 pm on
    Monday to Friday and  8 am to 1 pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Hoildays,in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.
